conversations.content: You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Hey, does the DAAD have offices in my country?

Yes, the DAAD has Regional Offices, Information Centres, and Information Points in over 60 countries. You can check their locations here: [https://www.daad.de/en/the-daad/map/daad-network/](https://www.daad.de/en/the-daad/map/daad-network/).

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
How can I contact the DAAD headquarters?

You can find the DAAD headquarters’ address and phone number on their contact page: [https://www.daad.de/en/the-daad/contact/addresses-telephone-numbers/](https://www.daad.de/en/the-daad/contact/addresses-telephone-numbers/).

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
What’s the "Study in Germany" campaign?
It’s an initiative by the DAAD to promote studying in Germany, supported by their global network of offices and experts.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Is my data safe if I click "Accept all" on the DAAD website?
No, data transferred to third parties via cookies may not have EU-level protection. You can manage cookie settings under "Cookies" at the bottom of the page.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Can I change my cookie preferences later?
Yes, you can adjust your consent for cookies anytime under the "Cookies" section at the end of the page.

Who runs the Study in Germany program?
The DAAD (German Academic Exchange Service) implements the campaign through its global network.
